use.flag: Toggle assertions
Library symbol versioning
support for large files
libblkid(3) - block device identification library
libfdisk library - manipulation with partition tables
libmount library - parse of /etc/fstab, /etc/mtab and /proc/self/mountinfo files, management of the mtab file, evaluation of mount options, etc.
Support /etc/mtab (default is use /proc/self/mountinfo)
libsmartcols library - smart adaptive formatting of tabular data
uuid(3) library - DCE compatible Universally Unique Identifier library
support uuidd even though the daemon is not built
agetty(8) - (alternative Linux getty) Open a terminal and set its mode
mkfs.bfs(8) - make an SCO bfs filesystem
blkdiscard(8) - Discard the content of sectors on a device
blkid(8) - locate/print block device attributes
blkzone(8) - run zone command on a device
blockdev(8) - call block device ioctls from the command line
col(1) - filter reverse line feeds from input
colcrt(1) - filter nroff output for CRT previewing
colrm(1) - remove columns from a file
column(1) - columnate lists
ctrlaltdel(1) - set the function of the Ctrl-Alt-Del combination
cal(1), ncal(1) - displays a calendar and the date of Easter
cfdisk(8) - display or manipulate a disk partition table; curses-based
chcpu(8) - configure CPUs in a multi-processor system
do not require the user to enter the password in chfn and chsh
choom(1) - display and adjust OOM-killer score
chrt(1) - manipulate the real-time attributes of a process
chsh: allow only shells listed in /etc/shells
fsck.cramfs(8), mkfs.cramfs(8) - fsck/make compressed ROM file system
dmesg(1) - print or control the kernel ring buffer
eject(1) - eject removable media
fallocate(1) - preallocate/deallocate space to/from a file
fdformat(8) - low-level format a floppy disk; obsolete
fdisk(8) - manipulate disk partition table
fincore(1) - count pages of file contents in core
findfs(8) - find a filesystem by label or UUID
findmnt(8) - find a filesystem
flock(1) - manage locks from shell scripts
fsck(8) - check and repair a Linux filesystem
fsfreeze(8) - suspend access to a filesystem (Ext3/4, ReiserFS, JFS, XFS)
fstrim(8) - discard unused blocks on a mounted filesystem
getopt(1) - parse command options (enhanced)
hardlink(1) - Consolidate duplicate files via hardlinks
hexdump(1) - display file contents in hexadecimal, decimal, octal, or ascii
hwclock(8) - query and set the hardware clock (RTC)
ionice(1) - set or get process I/O scheduling class and priority
ipcmk(1) - make various IPC resources
ipcrm(1) - remove certain IPC resources
ipcs(1) - show information on IPC facilities
isosize(8) - output the length of an iso9660 filesystem
kill(1) - send a signal to a process; better alternative to the one from sys-process/procps
last(1), lastb(1) - show listing of last logged in users
ldattach(8) - attach a line discipline to a serial line
line(1) - read one line
logger(1) - a shell command interface to the syslog(3) system log module
login(1) - begin session on the system; clashes with sys-apps/shadow
let login(1) chown /dev/vcsN
let login(1) stat() the mailbox
look(1) - display lines beginning with a given string
losetup(8) - set up and control loop devices
lsblk(8) - list block devices
lscpu(1) - display information about the CPU architecture
lsipc(1) - show information on IPC facilities currently employed in the system
lslocks(8) - list local system locks
lslogins(1) - display information about known users in the system
lsns(8) - list namespaces
mcookie(1) - generate magic cookies for xauth
mesg(1) - display (or do not display) messages from other users; obsolete
fsck.minix(8), mkfs.minix(8) - fsck/make Minix filesystem
mkfs(8) - build a Linux filesystem
mkswap(8) - set up a Linux swap area
more(1) - file perusal filter for crt viewing
mount(8), umount(8) - mount/unmount filesystem
mountpoint(1) - see if a directory or file is a mountpoint
namei(1) - follow a pathname until a terminal point is found
newgrp(1) - log in to a new group; clashes with sys-apps/shadow
nologin(8) - politely refuse a login; clashes with sys-apps/shadow
nsenter(1) - run program with namespaces of other processes
pg(1) - browse pagewise through text files; obsolete
let pg(1) not ring the bell on invalid keys
pivot_root(8) - change the root filesystem
prlimit(1) - get and set process resource limits
raw(8) - bind a Linux raw character device
readprofile(8) - read kernel profiling information
rename(1) - rename files
renice(1) - alter priority of running processes
rev(1) - reverse lines characterwise
rfkill(8) - tool for enabling and disabling wireless devices
rtcwake(8) - enter a system sleep state until specified wakeup time
runuser(1) - run a command with substitute user and group ID
script(1) - make typescript of terminal session
scriptreplay(1) - play back typescripts, using timing information
setarch(8) - change reported architecture in new program environment and set personality flags
setpriv(1) - run a program with different Linux privilege settings
setsid(1) - run a program in a new session
setterm(1) - set terminal attributes
sfdisk(8) - display or manipulate a disk partition table; script-oriented
su(1) - change user ID or become superuser; clashes with sys-apps/shadow
sulogin(8) - single-user login
swaplabel(8) - print or change the label or UUID of a swap area
swapon(8), swapoff(8) - enable/disable devices and files for paging and swapping
switch_root(8) - switch to another filesystem as the root of the mount tree
taskset(1) - set or retrieve a process's CPU affinity
tunelp(8) - set various parameters for the lp device (parallel line printer); obsolete
ul(1) - do underlining; obsolete
unshare(1) - run program with some namespaces unshared from parent
utmpdump(1) - dump UTMP and WTMP files in raw format
uuidgen(1) - create a new UUID value
uuidparse(1) - utility to parse unique identifiers
vipw(8), vigr(8) - edit the password, group, shadow-password or shadow-group file; clashes with sys-apps/shadow
wall(1) - write a message to all users; obsolete
wdctl(8) - show hardware watchdog status
whereis(1) - locate the binary, source, and manual page files for a command
wipefs(8) - wipe a signature from a device
write(1) - write to another user; obsolete
zramctl(8) - set up and control zram devices
uuid daemon
Python bindings for the libmount library
colorize output from utils by default
Care about plymouth in sylogin(8) and agetty(8)
Use emergency mount of /dev and /proc for sulogin
install wall and write setgid tty
use only /usr paths in PATH env. variable (recommended on systems with /bin -> /usr/bin symlinks)
build with support for btrfs
compile with libcap-ng
Compile with python support; required for pylibmount
compile with libz
compile with GNU Readline support
compile cfdisk with slang rather than ncurses
SMACK security subsystem support
compile with tinfo (low level lib from ncurses); obsolete
compile with libuser (remote chsh); obsolete
compile script(1) with libutempter
Compile with libutil, part of libc
